list_definition.definition: to cause to act in a particular way

list_ex_of_english: The choice of the third correlogram peak was not motivated by rigorous theoretical considerations but was also not arbitrary.
However, this strategy may not be motivated by language dominance alone.
Such an assumption might be motivated by the supposition that the agent has already considered the decision problem under the first presentation.
People have to be educated and motivated to segregate waste.
I do not take for granted, however, that everyone has the will or the interest to do so, if not motivated by good examples.
The principle must be motivated by other considerations.
Underlying these historically contingent details, and motivating their selection and deployment, is a particular type of plot structure.
The narrative determination of a universe motivates the segmentation of the time line into foreground and background (the former is treated as the present).
